Key Match Events: Virat Kohli and KL Rahul guided India to a comfortable six-wicket victory over Australia in their Cricket World Cup opener.
Mitchell Starc and Josh Hazlewood combined to send Rohit Sharma, Ishan Kashan, and Shreyas Iyer back to the pavilion for ducks.
India found themselves at 3-2 after the early onslaught.
Virat Kohli was dropped on 12 by Mitch Marsh, which proved costly as Kohli reached 85 before being caught at mid-wicket.
KL Rahul finished unbeaten on 97, and he and Kohli put on 165 for the fourth wicket.
Ravindra Jadeja was the pick of the spinners with 3-28.
Kuldeep Yadav took the crucial wicket of David Warner for 41.
Australia went 73 balls between boundaries and hit two in total between the 16th and 39th overs.
Australia's platform of 2-110 quickly eroded to 5-119 due to Jadeja's three wickets in 2.3 overs.
Mitchell Starc and Josh Hazlewood left India reeling with three wickets in the first two overs.
Post-Match Reflections: Australia captain Pat Cummins commented on the dropped catch by Mitch Marsh, stating it was not ideal, especially for someone of his calibre.
Pat Cummins reflected that with another 50 runs on the board, the bowling innings would have looked different.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India's three spinners bowled a combined 30 overs for 6-104.
Australia faced 174 dot balls in their innings.
Australia's spinners couldn't get the same purchase as India's spinners due to dewy conditions.
Ashton Agar was a late omission for the tournament due to a calf injury, limiting Australia's spin options.
